result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keon Patrick Canada

records.addlTxt: Court ordered case adjourned for status conference for November 29, 2022 at 8:30 am; VIA ZOOM.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Keon Patrick Canada not in court, in custody, appearance wavied.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hampton was recently appointed and is requesting another status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Completion of Representation
Received and Filed. Motion to Withdraw

OFF THE RECORD: Attorney Gregory W. Isaac in court, defendant Keon Patrick Canada not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appear via zoom. Defendant not produced. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. Further, defense counsel requests an additional Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br. 16.
  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 056077,
Payable Number: 1013644,
Receipt Number: 22RP024282,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Keon Patrick Canada in court, appear by video with attorney Colleen A Taylor, appear by video.  Defendant Keon Patrick Canada in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. DeWitt.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Keon Patrick Canada in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Keon Patrick Canada in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
